title: INsmh
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INsmh, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: He Stole Some Snacks, Got Shot in the Back(side)—Guess Who’s Behind Bars?
items.description: Some folks clock in at Family Dollar, others clock out criminals—just maybe not like this. In Indianapolis, a store worker decided he’d moonlight as vigilante security, chasing down a thief on a bike and shooting him square in the buttocks after a brief dollar-store manhunt. Jerome Stepp, the trigger-happy employee, now faces felony charges while the actual thief got away with a bruised ego and some bullet-caused ventilation. Moral of the story? Turns out you can get fired for going above and beyond. SMH. Read for yourself.

items.title: Woman in Robe Booted for Making a Sandwhich While in Court
items.description: Only in the age of Zoom justice can someone show up late to court, dressed like it’s laundry day, and think making a sandwhich is acceptable courtroom behavior. Detroit’s Asja Outerbridge joined her misdemeanor hearing rocking a robe and multitasking while making a sandwhich, only to get booted by a visibly angered Judge Sean Perkins. Her excuse? She had the wrong time (she didn't) and she was taking care of her child. Treating her court hearing like a casual FaceTime call. SMH.
